sen.j: 壇ノ浦夜合戦記（だんのうらのよるかっせんき）は、日本の古典春本の一つである。
sen.e: Dan no Ura Yoru no Kassennki is one of the Japanese classic pornographic novels.
Dan no Ura Yoru no Kassennki is the title of a Japanese classic pornographic novel.
sen.cmt: "one of" sounds a little unnatural here, so I changed it to "a Japanese pornographic novel"
sen.e: Dan no Ura Yoru no Kassenki is the title of a Japanese classic pornographic novel.

sen.j: 壇ノ浦の合戦の際、入水するも救出された建礼門院と、源義経の情事を描いたもの。
sen.e: The story line revolves around an affair between Kenreimonin who threw herself into the sea but was rescued during the Battle of Dan no ura and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune.
The story line revolves around a love affair between MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune and Kenreimonin, who threw herself into the sea and was rescued during the Battle of Dan no Ura.
sen.cmt: for 情事, added "love" before "affair"; capitalized "Ura" for consistency; moved "MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune" to earlier in the sentence since it was awkwardly placed
sen.e: The story line revolves around a love affair between MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune and Kenreimonin, who threw herself into the sea and was rescued during the Battle of Dan no Ura.

sen.j: 頼山陽の作と言われているが、仮託の可能性が高い。
sen.e: It is said that Sanyo RAI was the author of this book but there is a good likelihood that it was written by another person under the guise of Sanyo.
It is suggested that Sanyo RAI was the author of this book, but there is a high likelihood that it was written by another person under the guise of Sanyo.

sen.j: 壇ノ浦の合戦の際、心ならずも命長らえた平徳子。
sen.e: During the Battle of Dan no ura, TAIRA no Tokuko (Kenreimonin) was rescued against her will.

sen.j: 義経は徳子を慰めるべく酒宴を開き、家臣や女官たちに酒を振る舞う。
sen.e: To console Tokuko, Yoshitsune held a banquet giving a feast to his vassals and Tokuko's court ladies.

sen.j: その後、義経は徳子と二人きりになると、あの手この手を駆使して、情事に持ち込むことに成功する。
sen.e: After the banquet, being alone with Tokuko, Yoshitsune successfully started affair using his charm on Tokuko,

sen.j: なお、義経と建礼門院が通じるという話自体は「源平盛衰記」以来見られた。
sen.e: The story about an affair between Yoshitsune and Kenreimonin existed since it was mentioned in Genpei Seisuiki (The Rise and Decline of the Minamoto and Taira clans).

sen.j: 江戸時代には庶民の間にも膾炙しており、これに題材をとった狂歌なども読まれている。
sen.e: During the Edo period, it even became a well-known story among the general public and some kyoka (comic (satirical) tanka) were written with the affair between Yoshitsune and Kenreimonin being the subject.

sen.j: ただし、史実かどうかとなると、信憑性は殆ど無い。
sen.e: As to whether it was a historical fact, however, there is virtually no credibility to this story.
